intro: Dinetus malabaricus, commonly known as the Malabar sun-cup, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers that resemble small cups. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as under forest canopies. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its stems are often hairy. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
